Data-Driven Orchestration for Salesforce Data Cloud - Optimizing Workflows While Preserving Credits


Current Challenges


The Data Cloud IT team (customers and partners) can easily schedule various Data Cloud Data Flow steps (Data Transform, Identity Resolution, Calculated Insights, Segments). However, this scheduling approach presents several issues:


  • Undefined step duration: The execution time of each step can vary daily, potentially causing subsequent steps to begin before the previous ones complete. This can result in outdated information being used in the process.


  • Limited control over Identity Resolution: As per the documentation, "you can't change or control the timing" of Identity Resolution runs. This limitation exacerbates the risk of using outdated data in this critical, resource-intensive and expensive step of unifying records

Solution: ETOrchestrateDC


ETOrchestrateDC is a 100% data-driven solution that helps the IT team orchestrate Data Cloud Data Flow steps based on data readiness rather than arbitrary schedules, ensuring data quality and process efficiency.


Key Features


  • Data-driven execution: Steps are triggered when the required data is ready, eliminating the risk of using outdated information.


  • Flexible configuration: The Data Cloud IT team can easily configure the orchestration of different Data Cloud Data Flow steps.


  • Credit optimization: Administrators can set minimum intervals (in minutes, hours, or days) between executions of the same step, preventing redundant runs and conserving valuable credits. This feature enhances cost-effectiveness by ensuring steps only re-execute after a specified time has elapsed.


  • Comprehensive coverage: Orchestrates all major Data Cloud Data Flow steps, including Data Transform, Identity Resolution, Calculated Insights, and Segments.

By implementing ETOrchestrateDC, organizations can significantly improve the reliability and efficiency of their Data Cloud processes while maintaining high data quality standards and saving credits.
